moves.1. e4: Pl comment freely and pl rate - I am still learning and spend a week reading all yr comments
moves.2... exf4: he takes it, fasten yr seatbelts for here we go
moves.3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4: continue developing, ultimately the attack is on his f7 pawn - keep watching
moves.4... g4: ouch- for KG- this is the first sacrifice
moves.5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3: take with the queen which can move to h5 and further attack f7
moves.6... Qe7: now i think this is the best defense for black, getting his queen out.what do you think?
moves.7. Qxf4: f file is now open, but I still got to develop. wonder how he will protect f7
moves.8. Nc3: never mind, I develop- want to put this knight on d5
moves.8... c6: sos much so for my knight move !!
moves.9. d4: want to move to d5 and disrupt his queenside pawn structure
moves.9... b5: no problem- for I withdraw still attacking f7
moves.10. Bb3 b4: What would you do?? The knight can withdraw to e2
moves.11. Qc7: Beauty of Kings gambit- attack shifts direction. He takes my knight I take his bishop and check him
moves.11... Ba6: he counter attacks, but I have it worked out- I think, I hope. This is chess for adrenalin junkies. What would you do??
moves.12. Bxh6: removed his protection on f7,HAVE U SPOTTED IT NOW
moves.12... Bxf1: Rook sacrifice- he fell for it
moves.13. Qc8+: he wakes up to this new attack
moves.13... Qd8 14. Bxf7+: lost your queen mate. He resigns. Kings gambit - always unpredictable. 11- Q c7 was the key move.  Pl comment and rate freely. This is chess for fun, hope you enjoyed
